website_summaries.verdict: A very precise, if plain, rain gauge designed to track to 1/100".
pros: Measures up to 11" of rainfall, and measures even small amounts of rain
Can also be used to measure snowfall
cons: Measures first inch separately, making it a little cumbersome to measure total rainfall over 1"

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Precise Rain Gauge
customer_reviews.text: I have now bought 3 of these rain gauges. They are the recommended gauge for CoCoRaHS or Community Collaborative Rain, Hail and Snow Network. If you are not familiar, CoCoRaHS is a volunteer program where individuals, at home, record rain, hail and snow. The gauge is large and has 2 funnels for the collection of precipitation. In the winter you must remove the inner tube or if ice forms it will crack the tube. Or it did for me. These gauges last a long time and give a very precise measurement. Recommended but I also recommend you join CoCoRaHS as it is a great volunteer project, especially for a fun family project and extremely easy and educational.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly A. King

customer_reviews.title: Nice gauge, but it didn't last.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rain gauge 2 years ago. I just had to order a new one because the measuring tube in the middle split lengthwise. I live in Northern New Mexico. We don't have extreme weather, either hot or cold. It seems to me that it should have held up better than it did.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Baker

customer_reviews.title: The Best Rain Gauge you can buy!
customer_reviews.text: It's well constructed! Very Accurate! Easy to read, even with my aging eyes, LOL. It's the recommended gauge for CoCoRaHS or Community Collaborative Rain, Hail and Snow Network if you want to particpate in that! Will also measure snow amounts (if you use it correctly by removing the Inner Tube - Which you must do if you have freezing winters otherwise the tube will crack, This is NOT a defect in the Gauge. At first I thought it was pricey but after receiving it and seeing just how well it's made I think it's worth it! So much better then those cheap alternatives!
customer_reviews.author: FON

customer_reviews.title: Great and accurate rain guage
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a farmer, so knowing how much rain we've gotten is very important. This is a replacement for the one I bought from Wind and Weather for him years earlier. I was delighted to see this is the exact same one and cost half the price of the one I got earlier. It is very easy to set up, easy to read and easy to empty. To get the most accurate readings make sure you put up this rain gauge in an open area away from buildings, trees etc. That way you won't have anything obstructing of funneling the rain into the gauge. It will also measure snow just follow the instructions that are included with the gauge.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne

customer_reviews.title: Very Durable!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We are farmers and live in a windy area that tends to get more severe weather. This product is very durable and we love it. It is easy to read and install. When you get this product it comes with an order form for replacement parts and additional supplies. One of the items is a brush to clear the tube, I wish this were included in with the purchase of the item. The tubes can be difficult to clean out.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail Popowski

customer_reviews.title: Very precise rain gauge, nice price.
customer_reviews.text: No problems with this. Took only a few minutes to mount and takes seconds to read most wet mornings. Well graduated to 0.01 inch. Anything over 1 inch spills into the outer chamber. You pour it back into the graduate and add it all up. A handy tally sheet is included.Without this,I wouldn't have known we got 13 inches of rain in August--I'd just had to go by neighbors who said, it's never rained like this. Probably will take it down before winter to preclude freeze damage. Instructions for measuring snowfall seem a bit dodgy anyway. Downside: if you install it well away from structures as recommended for accuracy, you'll not be able to read it from inside.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Polson

customer_reviews.title: Precise and easy to read
customer_reviews.text: The nearest official rainfall total for my vegetable garden is in a town that’s 23 miles away; it’s useless for me. I bought this rain gauge, mounted it as described by another reviewer, and it does a great job. I don’t need to be able to read it from my window and I don’t mind the process for reading a total of more than an inch (we don’t get that much very often). It helps me manage the garden and it’s fun to see and record how much rain we get.
customer_reviews.author: ConstantReader

customer_reviews.title: The Most Accurate!
customer_reviews.text: CoCoRoHs approved! The 10:1 ratio makes it super accurate. I also have a wireless tipping-bucket type and this unit proves how the tipping bucket type reads low when the rain rate is high. If rain is less than ~0.1 to 0.2"/hour, the two agree within a couple percent. But if the rate gets up to the 2 to 5"/hour range, I have seen the tipping bucket run 18% low (2.96" vs. 3.59"). If only it was wireless and automatic!
customer_reviews.author: Tom F

customer_reviews.title: Great accurate rain gauge
customer_reviews.text: We have owned various simple rain gauges in the past but were never sure of their real accuracy. After purchasing this and comparing to the simple ones, we realized that the simple ones were inaccurate by a lot. This gauge measures down to 100ths of an inch. The tube only holds an inch of rain, then overflows into the larger tube, then that can be poured into the smaller one for additional measurements that were over an inch. If you really want an accurate measurement of rain, get this and skip the rest.
customer_reviews.author: Blarneystone

customer_reviews.title: This rain gauge takes the guess work out of your life.
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased one about 40 years ago. This is my 3rd rain gauge. All made just alike. A hint when you empty it , put a few drops of food color in the center tube. That way you do not have to go outside to see how much it rained. At a glance you will beable to estimate from inside, especially in the winter or a storm.
customer_reviews.author: Judy LeBlanc

customer_reviews.title: This rain gauge measures 1 inch of rain with extreme accuracy.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't read carefully enough. I thought I was buying a high capacity rain gauge. This one measures a single inch of rain with high accuracy, catching overflow in the large outer tube. You can use the inner tube to measure the amount of rain in excess of one inch... pouring it out of the outer tube . But sometimes here we have storms the last days, that drop several inches of rain, and the hassle of repeatedly having to manually measure the rain is annoying. On the other hand, at least this gauge will catch all of it.
customer_reviews.author: Lee N. Mcmillan

customer_reviews.title: Highly Accurate
customer_reviews.text: These gauges are the most accurate that I've used. They clearly measure to hundredths and it possible to estimate thousandths if you want to impress your friends. I live in an area that receives about 10 inches annually so we like to measure every drop. But, the nice thing about this gauge is that it has a graduated cylinder to accurately measure the first inch and an overflow feature that catches any amount over one inch that can be measured separately. Great gauges; I have one and have given others as presents.
customer_reviews.author: Raven Ranch

customer_reviews.title: Needs Design Improvements
customer_reviews.text: With rain over an inch, the water in the outside cylinder must be dumped into the inner cylinder to be measured. Instructions say to use the funnel during the exchange, so imagine holding the inner cylinder and funnel, and then pouring the outer cylinder! This could be simplified by adding a pour lip to the outer cylinder so its contents could be poured off without using the funnel. Or, provide a stand for the inner funnel to free up one's hands a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Bill of Rights

customer_reviews.title: For those that want accuracy to at  least 0.01"
customer_reviews.text: Like the fact I can even measure snow moisture content in the winter. Nice and accurate with 0.01" graduations on the small cylinder. Was somewhat of a bugger to get it level on the tree "stump" I mounted it on but that is more a function of the tree stump and how it was cut. Comparing to a Davis Weather Station they both agree with each other plus or minus but they are mounted about 200 yards apart so that probably explains any differences.
customer_reviews.author: L. R. B.

customer_reviews.title: Finally an accurate measure
customer_reviews.text: Every time I told my husband how much rain we had gotten, he would always tell me my readings were too high. How hard can it be? You put out a calibrated test tube and read the total. I have to admit though, my readings were always a lot higher than the weather man on TV. I decided to put this argument to rest. I purchased a Stratus Precision rain gauge after approval from my son’s girlfriend, who is a meteorologist with the National Weather Service. The readings are much more precise, down to 100th of an inch. They make much more sense. It’ Easy to install and use. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This product met my expectations. It is simple to install and to use. To measure the amount of snowfall, I remove the cone on the top. The device is sturdy and should stand up to the Wyoming wind. Time will tell was effect the sun at high elevation has on it.
customer_reviews.author: Geo

customer_reviews.title: Truly a great rain gauge
customer_reviews.text: I had a rain gauge like this before that gave me a LOT of years of service before the sun finally degraded it to cracking. Replaced it with a Davis weather station that I enjoyed, but at present location, no good site for it. Long story short - this is a FABULOUS rain gauge that gives really accurate measurements - is built to withstand years of weather abuse. Note to 1st time users in winter: remove the inner tube and top funnel when freezing weather arrives and store in a place where you'll find it in the spring. This gauge works great for snow as well. As a weather nut, this gauge is top notch!
customer_reviews.author: Derek Thomas

customer_reviews.title: My second one.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Stratus rain gauge. After about 25 years the plastic in the original one got brittle and it broke in a couple of spots. I can live with that useful lifespan. If you want accurate rainfall readings to .01 inch this is the gauge you want. Just make sure you put in in an open spot.
customer_reviews.author: WisFan

customer_reviews.title: Good gauge for accurate measurements
customer_reviews.text: This gauge replaces one by the same maker that died after 18 years of use. from photo-degradation. Very accurate and easy to read. I have used this gauge for scientific work in recording rainfall combined with streamflow measurements of small watersheds. It is an acceptable gauge for such work as the error is, I believe less than 0.02" with good repeatablility (I guess that is precision). The price has gone up about 12$ in 18 years, so about $1.75 per annum for a 40$ gauge, not too bad. You do have to read it and then empty it but it will store multiple inches of precip from a large event.
customer_reviews.author: Newton Millham

customer_reviews.title: All Weather Rain Gauge is NOT All Weather
customer_reviews.text: Bought this relatively expensive gauge based on both the accuracy and the supposed All Weather capability. I took the “All Weather” claim to mean it could be left out in all weather, namely freezing weather. However, the very first paragraph of the included instructions states, “Do not allow accumulated water to freeze in the gauge.” It’s a nice, well-made product, and I’m quite certain that it’s accuracy claims are justified. But, sadly, I’ll be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Hoss

customer_reviews.title: NOT your grandpa’s rain gauge!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant paying over $30 for a plastic rain gauge, but when this arrived and I unboxed it, I realized fast that this is NOT your grandpa’s garden rain gauge! This thing is SOLID and well made. It’s also pretty large and as advertised, appears very professional. This is a rain gauge for people who need a super precise rain measurement. If you don’t really care about precision, this isn’t for you - you’d be better off with a cheaper one. If you want to know exactly how much rain you’re getting, and own a very well made and designed weather instrument, this IS for you!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Wesley

customer_reviews.title: Accurate gauge, good build quality, birds poop on it.
customer_reviews.text: Nice rain gauge, but birds like to perch on it and poop and pee in it... to prevent this you need to install some small nails around the upper perimeter so they can't land on it, then it works fine. Maybe they could redesign this to make it bird resistant....
customer_reviews.author: Derrick

customer_reviews.title: NO WARRANTY
customer_reviews.text: the inner tube cracked within the year.. the manufacturer Stratus (who lists their phone number on the product- for what?) said there was no warranty on their product??????. Amazon was also not helpful and told me to contact the manufacturer.. AVOID!
customer_reviews.author: James G. Bodin

customer_reviews.title: Check inner Gauge for leaks
customer_reviews.text: After using the gauge for a week I discovered that inner tube had a small leak and was leaking water into the large tube. I was continually getting about 25% less rain than in my other gauges. To check it I filled the inner tube half full and the next morning it was down to .27 inch. I Expect a replacement in the next few days and hope it is more accurate and not defective. Otherwise I cannot vouch for its accuracy or longevity.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wesch

customer_reviews.title: needs a better fit and design
customer_reviews.text: Its a backup to my Davis vantage pro Seems like it does not fit together the inside tube seems to short and does not stay in place difficult to put the top piece on. Unit could be good if center tube stays in place when trying to put the top on. It needs a raised rim on the bottom of the outside tube so that the inside tube will stay in place. The top cover should have a twist lock to avoid it being blown of in heavy wind.
customer_reviews.author: H B

customer_reviews.title: Been using it for three years now
customer_reviews.text: Professional, accurate precipitation gauge that I've now used for three years in rain, snow and harsh western sun and it's still going strong! The mount is convenient and easy to install, the tubes are reasonably easy to clean, and the scale is easy to read to an accuracy of a one-hundredth of an inch! I've convoked three of the neighbors in our community to get one so we can compare rainfall variations over time.
customer_reviews.author: BST

customer_reviews.title: If it ain't broke, don't fix it.  Great design!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly and in good condition. I had a post prepared several days ago and installed the mounting bracket from a unit I purchased under the Weather Channel brand about 30 years ago. The new unit fits the yellowed old bracket perfectly (now I have a spare). I don't think there's been any change made to this rain gauge, other than branding, in decades. And why would they change anything? It's perfect. Ma Nature thoughtfully provided me with a rain shower of 0.43 inches less than two hours after delivery. :-) I'm a recently registered CoCoRaHS member and this is their preferred device. Lord knows why their preferred observation time is 7:00 AM, that's just looney tunes. Whatever.
customer_reviews.author: Victor in PC

customer_reviews.title: What I needed to participate in CoCoRahs
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old daughter and I are loving using this rain gauge to monitor precipitation in our area. It allows me to teach her about data collection, weather, climate, and basic charting and recording of data. As a science teacher I know that many kids struggle with these concepts, and the practice will help her to do better in math as well as science. It is a very easy to read, and sturdily built rain gauge and I expect it to last quite a while. My only concern is plastic degradation by prolonged exposure to sunlight. We will see how that works out.
customer_reviews.author: marshall7707

customer_reviews.title: Most accurate
customer_reviews.text: This is the most accurate rain gauge I have found. It has 1/100th inch graduations so you can tell exactly how much you have collected. You may compare with or provide the data to a meteorologist for your area. When the first tube fills to 1 inch, it overflows to the larger tube. Then after emptying the 1 inch tube you transfer the remaining rain from the larger tube to the 1 inch tube for a completely accurate collection. This is actually more accurate than an electronic rain collector I have. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Best of the Best
customer_reviews.text: This is my second rain gauge of this type but the first in acrylic which is a harder version of plastic. I wouldn’t have any other type. It is so accurate for even over 10” of rain which can happen in our Midwest area. If you want the best and take yourself seriously as a wanna be meteorologist then this one is for you. Enjoy the years of confidence and satisfaction for owning the best.
customer_reviews.author: J.D. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great gauge for everyone.
customer_reviews.text: I'm in love with this rain gauge. We mounted it by a gate we drive through and it's crystal clear and easy to read. I had bought the "worlds coolest rain gauge" before, which was pretty but I don't think it was very accurate. This product is great for a farmer who needs keep track of precip. going on their field. I will be buying another one to mount at work!
customer_reviews.author: Meg V.

customer_reviews.title: Accurate gauge that will last for years
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase after 8 years. The sun will eventually cloud the plastic to make it difficult to read graduations. Gauge is otherwise sturdy and well made. Mounting screws are not a great fit for the countersink screw holes, so I used different screws.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: OK, but others would be better
customer_reviews.text: So, this one has an internal graduated cylinder which measures down to the hundredth of an inch. While that is nice, once the rainfall goes over one inch it simply goes into a big catch cylinder. To find out how much rain you actually had, you have to remove the internal cylinder, empty it and keep refilling it to add up the inches. Very inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth R Flowers

customer_reviews.title: Best Manual Rain Gauge Ever!!
customer_reviews.text: This plastic rain gauge is awesome! It shows one inch of rain in 0.01" increments and will hold over 10" of rain in backup. Very sturdy construction and solid mounting bracket. Simplicity is perfection. Also, the manufacturer is a non-profit out of Wisconsin and they specialize in job placement for the disadvantaged. Buy one just for that!!
customer_reviews.author: Osotoh

customer_reviews.title: GREAT rain gauge
customer_reviews.text: I balked at the cost of this thing and almost did not purchase it because of the price. However, I was tired of having to constantly replace cheap rain gauges that did not hold up well. I don't think I am going to be disappointed. The plastic of the large outer container must be 1/4" thick or so! The inner container is more like the thickness of the rain gauges you would purchase at your hardware store. It works well, and I expect to be using it for a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Lumberjack

customer_reviews.title: A must have for CoCoRaHS
customer_reviews.text: I have been recording rainfall for Cocorahs in SE OK since 2012 with my original gauge. The old one is still usable although it's getting kind of dingy. Bought this one on a price drop for 29.99
customer_reviews.author: Code Grey

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read from inside the house; easy to empty
customer_reviews.text: My first one lasted only seven years because I didn't empty it out before a freeze which broke the inner water collector. It probably would have lasted for years to come. This is easy to read from inside the house and measures the first inch of rain in 1/100th of an inch gradations. The next ten inches of rain can be read off in tenths of an inch if you're close - total capacity eleven inches of rainfall. More than adequate for most places.
customer_reviews.author: Andy BealsTop Contributor: Clarinets

customer_reviews.title: Best rain gauge
customer_reviews.text: This is in a class by itself. Easy to use and very accurate. The plastic is very durable; I have used one for more than 20 years and it would still be good except we had a lot of rain followed by snow and freezing weather, which seriously cracked the inner tube when the water froze. The new one seems exactly the same and also of the same high quality
customer_reviews.author: cwbidaho

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement gauge from the one I have had over three years out on my farm. It gets heavy use but it has lasted a long time. Very easy to read, and durable quality. My old one just froze and broke, but it survived heavy winters for three years. I will continue to replace if it breaks with the cold again. Happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Comstock

customer_reviews.title: Perfect match for my original NOAA/NWS-issued gauge
customer_reviews.text: This a very substantial product, and it's made to last. The 4 inch funnel and the inner 1 inch gauge meet government standards for a COCORAHS and SKYWARN weather observer to get reliable, accurate rainfall measurements. That, and it looks good, too. I give five stars and a pair of thumbs up to the Stratus Precision Rain Gauge.
customer_reviews.author: A. Holden

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for 8-year old rain gauge
customer_reviews.text: I initially ordered this rain gauge in 2011 and after of 8 year of exposure to the harsh south Texas weather, although still fully functional, I decided to replace it. I was delighted to discover the exact same product (at least as far as I can tell) was still available. The most pleasing aspect is that the new rain gauge fits in the mounting bracket from the original, meaning installing the new rain gauge was a snap! So pleased!
customer_reviews.author: REM

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to mount. Measures rain accurately in 100s of inches. You can log in to the national weather service (daily at around the same time) to make your observations---the more the better their data. I have to figure out how to be dependable enough to do that on days it rains not! This is a terrific rain guage!
customer_reviews.author: TouchingPaws

customer_reviews.title: Excellent rain gauge!
customer_reviews.text: Like a lot of people I bought this to participate in CoCoRaHS. Had some sprinkles this past weekend, measured at .055 inches. My old gauge was 1/4" resolution. It's heavy, too, not flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Mindless Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Good solid rain gauge
customer_reviews.text: I had used one of these for several years and then I quit checking it for a few months which allowed the plastic to get so discolored I could no longer read the numbers. My fault; not the rain gauge. I bought the new one to replace that old one. It is the one that CoCoRAHS recommends because of its accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: M. E. Duval

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice rain gauge.
customer_reviews.text: When I first opened it, I was disappointed because I thought it would only measure up to 1" of rainfall based on the markings of the inner catch tube. Then I realized the overflow went into the outer container and you simply had to empty the inner catch tube and fill it from the outer container until you had emptied the outer container. You can measure a pretty heavy rainfall with this system. Very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong
customer_reviews.text: I live in a mediteraian climate here in northern cal. We have had 70 inches of rain since October 1st and still have 3 more months to go. Wish I had bought this when I first moved here. For $35 you can't go wrong. Nothing to break should last for years providing I don't do something stupid. I can take the unit off the base bracket and leave it in the garage durning the 5-6 months that we don't get any rain. Very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: D. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Discoloration
customer_reviews.text: However, it has proven pretty accurate. It's probably about 6 yrs old. I will replace it with another one. The plastic top cracked and has a large chip out of it. It was also recommended as an accurate gauge. The plastic has "fogged up" and I have to go to the deck to read it.
customer_reviews.author: Boogie47

customer_reviews.title: Neat gauge
customer_reviews.text: The rain gauges I have did not agree, so I got this one on a recommendation from a friend who charts for the weather bureau. Something not mentioned in the paperwork, and it IS just an estimation, but when the 1" tube is full and the "overflow" is in the outer tube, the 1/00th mark on the inner tube = 1/10 in. This is handy to see if you check the gauge while it is still raining.
customer_reviews.author: BirdWhisperer

customer_reviews.title: In My Opinion
customer_reviews.text: This product may be OK for those looking to know exactly how much precipitation you received and when. However, for the common user, it was prohibitive for my needs. I returned the item for a refund. The product was well made and looked to be easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Timby

customer_reviews.title: Bottom cracked in less than 6 months
customer_reviews.text: The bottom in this cracked in less than 6 months. We could never get the tube to register any rain. It is in a post in the middle of my yard with nothing near it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Precision instrument
customer_reviews.text: I got this gage to replace one that was similar to it, but was over 30 years old. The old one was looking forlorn after being out in the weather over 30 years. I like that it accurately measures precipitation in 1/100 of an inch increments. I now have over 30 years of rainfall data for my area. It is easy to use, and accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Gary N Ca

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy accurate count.
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace mine after thunderstorm and neighbor’s shingles hit my stand and cracked. I had original one for almost three years so I expect this one of equal quality to last as long or longer. I also do CoCoRAHS daily rain count so needed replacing quickly sbd gotvit the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Good game

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Works well as advertised. No problem with measuring when it is more than an inch- when it overflows into the larger container. Simple and well built- heavy duty plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Curt Mattingly

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: We knew as soon as we put this up we would not have any more rain...or so we thought. The very next morning we went to read what kind of "Sprinkles" we had overnight and were pleasantly surprised to see we had a 10th of an inch. Love this thing! Easy to read, empty and heavy enough that it should withstand our wind and hopefully our freezing weather this winter.
customer_reviews.author: Liz  Lee

customer_reviews.title: Do not let it freeze!
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing. It is billed as an all weather rain gauge, but you have to empty water out before it freezes. The product description didn’t mention this. The instructions with the rain gauge stated it. In southern Missouri we get rain/freezing rain quickly followed by freezing temps regularly. I needed a gauge that can handle freezing.
customer_reviews.author: R. Dugas

customer_reviews.title: Love this rain gauge
customer_reviews.text: I live in NC. We get a good deal of rain, but not usually deluges. This is the best rain gauge - my whole family loves it. It has a funnel at the top, and an inner tube that lets you see when you get less than an inch of rain; if you get more than an inch, the inner tube spills over to the larger cylinder. If you're getting snow, you can take off the funnel and take out the inner tube, and it measures snowfall. It's very accurate and easy to see, and the increments are practical for my geographic/meteorological area.
customer_reviews.author: Both Professional and Fun

customer_reviews.title: I like this rain gauge
customer_reviews.text: I like this rain gauge. It will hold eleven inches of rainfall. The funnel at the top directs the rain into the inner tube which is marked in hundredths of an inch. When the inner tube gets full that represents one inch of rain. As more rain enters the gauge it spills over the inner tube into the outer tube which is also measured by the markings on the inner tube--each tenth of an inch on the inner tube reading represents one inch of additional rainfall in the outer tube. This equals one inch in the inner tube and ten inches in the outer tube when full, thus making eleven inches total.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Muhle

customer_reviews.title: Necessary for Skywarn
customer_reviews.text: Want to be a volunteer weather person? Take the basic and advance NWS Skywarn classes, buy this rain gauge and start taking pretty dang accurate reads of rainfall to share with the NWS (National Weather Service)
customer_reviews.author: michael d mitchell

customer_reviews.title: NWS approved guage.
customer_reviews.text: I have used these before. They are the only one that is consumer rated and approved by the National Weather Service. They are accurate. The last one I had performed for 10 years before it got brittle from sun light exposure. They are easily damaged by hail too. You can buy individual parts though.
customer_reviews.author: B. Brown

customer_reviews.title: we wasted a few drops
customer_reviews.text: We don’t get much rain where we live. So only got three chances to use it, but it’s really accurate. It measures rainfall to the hundredths an inch. The second rainfall was over an inch and because we, not expecting more than two inches, weren’t watching when we poured the rain from the larger section, we wasted a few drops. We will be more careful. The plastic is very sturdy and measurements are easy to read. We easily mounted it on a four by four post.
customer_reviews.author: RVartist

customer_reviews.title: Accurate Gage
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate gage. Mount should be a little stronger as its somewhat easy to crack when attaching to a post. After the first inch you have to pour each inch from the big cylinder into the calibrated one. We had an 8.25 inch storm and its a bit of a pain to measure each inch without spilling any. Overall a very good gage but the mount needs a little work as its fragile.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is my third one (for different properties) and have given many to friends and family as gifts. Everyone wants one after they see ours. They are just plain an awesome product. Extremely accurate, large and fun to use. I scrub them up at the end of the season and store. After many years the thick plastic does get cloudyish , but overall the best rain gauge I have ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Pianonoter

customer_reviews.title: How Long It Lasts
customer_reviews.text: I bought one from Amazon in October, 2012. It is now May, 2019. It still does the job, but it is showing its age. I live in Texas and the hot sun is making the plastic deteriorate. I plan on buying another one and set to aside for when the current rain gauge gives up the ghost. Definitely a recommended buy.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel C. Hayner

customer_reviews.title: Lost top in moderate winds...
customer_reviews.text: Works well but winds blow top off. Needs to have some sort of twist lock to keep top from blowing away. Not sure if parts to repair are available. If so, I will add some sort of leash for funnel top.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H.

customer_reviews.title: just remove the lid and center column and the outer shell collects snowfall in a way that's easy to measure
customer_reviews.text: This is a near-perfect rain gauge, since it clearly registers any amount of rain from 1/100 inch to 11 inches. When snow is predicted, just remove the lid and center column and the outer shell collects snowfall in a way that's easy to measure. The only negative, which is very minor, is that in my damp climate (Pacific Northwest) mold eventually starts to grow inside the unit. If you clean it out with soap, water, and a little bleach, no problem. But if you put this in the dishwasher, it melts, and you're left with a disfunctional unit that looks like it was designed by Salvador Dalî.
customer_reviews.author: Jim McCausland

customer_reviews.title: CoCoRaHS Official Rain Guage
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy heavy duty plastic rain gauge but do not let water freeze in it or it will crack. It is the same as the CoCoRaHS Official Rain Gauge used to measure and log daily rainfall. If you are not familiar look it up and you can set up your place that you install your rain gauge as a official observer sight and you will be given a official weather station ID on the map showing the location. Everyday at 7 Am you will log the amount of rainfall on the site that you had since 7 AM the previous day.
customer_reviews.author: Britt

customer_reviews.title: Very sensitive
customer_reviews.text: The large diameter of the funnel makes reading even light rain or mist easy. Rain seems to flow around or through leaf/debris that falls into funnel. I can't tell how accurate this gauge is as it has much better resolution than my old gauge but it measures close to my electronic self emptying gauge and I trust this gauge to be my standard.
customer_reviews.author: Henry J

customer_reviews.title: Best rain gauge ever!
customer_reviews.text: This rain gauge is well made and easy to read. The best part is it's accuracy. Can't be topped. This is my second one. The first one lasted for well over 20 yrs. Yes, it's a little more expensive, but I have certainly gotten my moneys worth.
customer_reviews.author: Prairie Princess

customer_reviews.title: Official rain gauge.
customer_reviews.text: Get one of these and sign up for CoCoRAHs (Community Collaborative Rain, Hail & Snow Network) - report daily precipitation in your back yard online, helps the weather service.
customer_reviews.author: lotsamice

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install however...
customer_reviews.text: I like the product but thought the spillover basin would have some kind of measuring scale, you have to pour it from there into the 1" measuring tube to figure your total rainfall episode but it's not that big a deal.
customer_reviews.author: mike d.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I have had one of these gauges for a long time gave one away as a gift and finally needed to replace mine. It went through many winters and summer hail storms finally was broken by hail. This is a direct replacement for my older unit wouldn't want to be without works great I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Does the job admirably.
customer_reviews.text: It's not like this had thousands of moving parts. It was easy to install (drill a few screws in a back plate) on a post. Maybe use a level to make sure that it is level). Attach the rain gauge to the back plate.
customer_reviews.author: MadScientist

customer_reviews.title: Love this rain gauge.  Our 2nd one, the first lasted fifteen years!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, accurate and durable. We had one like this previously and it lasted 15 years. Still worked, was just getting hard to read with damage from the Arizona sun and temperature variations.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Hale

customer_reviews.title: So accurate!...
customer_reviews.text: My third one. Best rain gauge I've ever found. IF..... I would take it inside before we freeze for the winter (MN) I probably could have gotten by with only two of them.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Naas

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly easy and accurate
customer_reviews.text: This thing is actually really great. Super accurate, easy to use, and can measure up to 10” of rain if you follow them measure-dump-fill-measure method. Read the instructions. Easy to install. Works great. Really glad I chose this over something electronic.
customer_reviews.author: Will Keim

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: This rain gauge is a smaller version of, but just as accurate as, the rain gauge provided to me by the National Weather Service when I was a NWS cooperative observer volunteer for my neighborhood. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: EAG

customer_reviews.title: Most Accurate
customer_reviews.text: This is our second rain gauge. The first one was a Christmas gift which lasted for about 8-9 years. With UV degradation of the Texas sun it will crack a little until the material will eventually leak. This is not a major concern as the design is the best residential rain measuring technique that money can buy.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Wigzell

customer_reviews.title: Best rain gauge we've ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: Simple, easy to use and mount. Easy to read and measure precipitation in 1/100ths of an inch increments. This rain gauge has stood up to direct sunlight and temperatures in excess of 110 F for over a year with no sign of deterioration. Unless it gets hit by lightening or the post gets run over by a vehicle, this may well be the last rain gauge we will ever need to own.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie J. Kerns

customer_reviews.title: Use what the professionals use!
customer_reviews.text: Recently I started doing volunteer work for the local TV stations meteorologist. When I started he told me this was the rain gauge I needed to get. I saw the price and thought he was nuts. I grew up using $5 to $10 rain gauges. Now more than 3 years later I look back and think what a great purchase. There are some cool digital rain gauges out there but the beauty of this one is it keeps the most accurate totals, requires no batteries and is totally weather proof. I love it. Bought one from my brother and father as well, and they both love them.
customer_reviews.author: FoundItOnAmazon

customer_reviews.title: A reliable, scientifically-accurate raingauge
customer_reviews.text: This is the only kind of rain gauge I will use. I have kept a weather record for more than 40 years, using this kind of scientific gauge. Furthermore, they are tough. I have just replaced one that lasted more than twelve years.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and dependable rain guage
customer_reviews.text: I have a electronic rain gauge, but because I joined CoCoRaHS (Community Collaborative Rain, Hail and Snow Network) I had to have an manual one to measure rainfall. This was the one they recommended. I followed the instructions and had it mounted in about 1/2 hour. It has not rained much here in SW Florida since I got it a few months back, but when it has it is spot on with my electronic one. It looks sturdy and should last a while.
customer_reviews.author: Jhon

customer_reviews.title: Neat Accurate gauge
customer_reviews.text: has a large catchment area as opposed to the small glass/plastic typical cheap cylinder gauges. When you get 15-16 inches of rain per year, it is nice to know how much you exactly received to know how much you'll have to supplement with groundwater for garden and limited landscaping growth.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great design, flawless performance
customer_reviews.text: I have about 8 months of use on this thing now. One night it rained over 5 inches. No problem, the rain gauge caught all of it. It's easy to read to the nearest 0.01 inches without going and finding reading glasses. During long dry spells it tends to accumulate little pieces of debris so it's a good idea to shake it out every week or so. The mounting is easy to do, easy to remove the gauge for reading and emptying, easy to put it back in place. I'd call this the gold standard in analog rain gauges.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.Science

customer_reviews.title: Easy Access to Rain Amounts
customer_reviews.text: My first rainfall collected was 1.10 inches. Using the two tube method gets a good accurate reading. I am some distance from a weather collection information provider. This will be fun and provide comparable data. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Karte Guy

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We had a rain gauge like this already, but after many decades the surface of the plastic had gotten so crazed it was difficult to read. This one is nice and clear. It's a lot more accurate than a typical cheap rain gauge. Okay, you probably don't *need* that much accuracy, but if you're interested in a precise instrument to measure your precip, you'll like this rain gauge.
customer_reviews.author: CindyTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Great Analog Water gauge.
customer_reviews.text: Great analog water gauge, not so great snow gauge. You are supposed to bring it inside and melt the snow to get a water equivalent which doesn't make sense if I want to measure snowfall. Easy to use and great for the garden to keep track of how much I water. Next year I will use my old electronic water gauge tho so I can keep track from inside the house.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew G.

customer_reviews.title: It is very durable and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this rain gauge to replace an identical product that is showing the effects of being outdoors for that last 15 or more years. The plastic is getting quite cloudy and a couple of cracks have developed in the collection tube. I suspect I won't have to buy another one until about 2030 now. It is very durable and easy to use. The accuracy of measurements is also quite good.
customer_reviews.author: B. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: nothing like a new rain gauge
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these 30+ years ago, had to retire it. Still worked but plastic discolored and couldn't read the rain from inside my house, 20 feet away. The old one cost @$18 back then. This is an "official" rain gauge used by weather people Gov't, TV, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Steve  Osborn

customer_reviews.title: Only good for 1 inch of rain
customer_reviews.text: Only measures 1 inch of rain at a time. Who has the time or desire to measure and dump. Somebody had good idea but gave up on design. An embarrassment to sell this poorly thought out product.
customer_reviews.author: S.P.Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Luckily I found this one on Amazon to replace it and it is even better than the previous one he had
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Dad as a Christmas gift. He had a previous rain gauge on the fence, but when they built a new fence, the old one got thrown away. Luckily I found this one on Amazon to replace it and it is even better than the previous one he had. He immediately put it up on the fence, and with all the rain this winter, it is working great and my dad really enjoys checking it during the rainy season. It is solidly built and will withstand harsh weather. Very easy to put on the fence.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is an incredible rain gauge
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for years. They are great. My dogs loved my old one too much :) I had to get another because the old one is destroyed. I will always have one of these to keep accurate records of rainfall.
customer_reviews.author: J. Chesney

customer_reviews.title: Stratus Accuracy Versus Ease Of Quick Readings
customer_reviews.text: This is simply the best gauge you can get for the money if accuracy down to 100ths. of an inch is what you want in your rainfall observations and records, or if you want to read the water content of snowfall. Electronic rain gauges are prone to calibration errors. The Stratus design is also a must if you want to join the network of volunteer observers. If you're just a casual or infrequent observer there are gauges that you can easily read at a distance or electronic gauges. I have another gauge with big numbers I can read from my window without going outside, but the marks are only at quarter inch intervals and it doesn't read snow water content.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Burns

customer_reviews.title: Quality, durable and accurate product
customer_reviews.text: Really nice, quality rain gauge. I never really knew how much rain a given storm brought, but wonder no more! We have a large backyard orchard so this is very helpful. Easy to read, seems durable, and looks nice mounted out in the yard. Too bad it doesn't help attract rain.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Johnson

customer_reviews.title: This is a great rain gauge
customer_reviews.text: This is a great rain gauge. This is the third one I have owned. After 15 years or so in Texas sun, the plastic becomes cloudy and ugly, although still functional. I decided to replace my old one. They have improved the design of the funnel, but otherwise it is identical to my two previous units.
customer_reviews.author: Diluted Waters

customer_reviews.title: Precision rain gauge!!
customer_reviews.text: This rain gauge, while more expensive than our last rain gauge, is very accurate and very easy to read. We now wish we had ordered this gauge instead of the old one (which actually leaked!).
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is the real deal, it isn't one of those gimmicky things. It's accurate and very easy to use. The plastic is quite sturdy and it appears it'll last a while.
customer_reviews.author: William Viands

customer_reviews.title: This Rain Gage can only take about 2-3 Arizona Summers
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 Stratus Precision rain Gauges in 2015. In 2018 after 2 summers in Arizona, I could barely read the inter tube. It is pretty much impossible to read the inter tube today, 4 years later. I could easily read the inter tube the first two years. I loved it the first two years. They need to make the outer tube more restive to UV Rays. If you buy it, plan or replacing it every three years.
customer_reviews.author: AZ_Dave

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Top quality rain gauge that is easy to read and accurate. The last several years in the direct sunlight. My previous one broke because the pressure treated post rotted and fell over. That should give you an idea of how long they last.
customer_reviews.author: Abc

customer_reviews.title: Can Be Used For Cocorahs
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made professional product for precision measurements for NOAA, SkyWarn, Cocorahs, etc. It is well worth the price and removes questions of variations in styles and brands. If you use this one, you know it's right!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Goodling

customer_reviews.title: Worthy of weather geeks
customer_reviews.text: This is an incredibly accurate instrument. It also makes measuring snow reliable. It comes with a chart for recording the entire year's precipitation as well. Anyone who loves to keep stats on the weather will love this. Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Patty Montgomery

product_meta.title: Stratus Precision Rain Gauge with Mounting Bracket (14" All Weather)
product_meta.description:
Size:14" x 5" x 5" (Length x Width x Height)A rain gauge that's actually made to last.

Pick up an extra one for a friend - they'll thank you.

It doesn't matter if you're a meteorologist or backyard enthusiast, this rain gauge is perfect for everyone. A great tool for teaching kids about weather, keeping track of rainfall amounts to water your lawn, and everything in between.

Easily and accurately monitor rainfall, snow, sleet and hail amounts with the Stratus Rain Gauge, a precision weather instrument built to United States Weather Bureau specifications. Official weather observers around the country rely on these standards for accurate weather reporting. Constructed of heavy-duty, UV resistant polycarbonate, this rain gauge will stand up to years of rough weather and full sun without fading or corroding.

A funnel top on the rain gauge catches rain and delivers it to a one-inch measuring tube, while the extra-large outer cylinder captures rain volumes over one inch up to 11 inches, and can be detached to measure snow, hail, or sleet. The Stratus is accurate to 1/100th of an inch.

Installing the rain gauge on a post (away from buildings and trees) is easy with its exclusive "Quick Connect" bracket, which lets you quickly remove the cylinder for easy measurement or cleaning (and there are no metal parts to rust).
feature_bullets: QUALITY: The last rain gauge you'll ever need to buy.
PRECISE: Accurate to 1/100th of an inch and easy to read. Built to US Weather Bureau standards.
EASY TO INSTALL: Install the rain gauge on a post with its exclusive "Quick Connect" bracket, which lets you quickly remove the cylinder for easy measurement or cleaning.

RUGGED: Constructed of heavy duty, UV resistant polycarbonate (no metal parts to rust), this high quality rain gauge will stand up to years of rough weather and full sun without fading or corroding. Heat and frost resistant.

VERSATILE: The first inch of rain funnels through the 4" diameter top into a specially calibrated measuring tube. Even a light shower registers clearly in increments of 100ths of an inch. Additional rainfall up to a total of 11" is contained in the outer cylinder until measured separately in the calibrated tube.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars1,381 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
